newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - June 30.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - June 30.

text.p: These are significant items in the Ivorian press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these items and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Head of Ivory Coast's customs, Adama Coulibaly, says that the service aims to help the business community meet its objectives while putting in place proper checks to ensure it meets its own revenue gathering targets; says the service's computer system needs radical update

- Hope of return to classes at Ivory Coast's largest university, Cocody in the commercial capital Abidjan, start to fade; student leader Guillaume Soro says government refusal to agree student demands puts his credibility in question, making it difficult for him to lift a boycott call

- Armed robbers break into the flat of the Abidjan Appeal Court prosecutor, hold-up those there at gunpoint and make off with a television and music recorder; prosecutor Aka Noba Denis was absent at the time of the burglary.
- Government likely to make 326 of the 1,200 staff at state forest management company SODEFOR redundant

- World Bank report says poverty increased from 10 percent to 36.8 percent in Ivory Coast between 1985 and 1995; says Ivory Coast spent more than average on health and education but that performance in these sectors was below that of countries with same or fewer resources; adds percentage of Ivorians over 15 able to read slipped from 54 percent in 1990 to 29 percent in 1995.

- Chambre of Agriculture investment arm FINAGRI (La Financiere Agricole de la Cote d'Ivoire), set up in December, invests in projects ranging from an abbatoir in Abidjan in association with South African group Abakor to farm machinery assembly plant and marketing network in association with Chinese entrepreneurs.
- Head of Ivory Coast's LIDHO human rights league, Rene Degni-Segui, says that a 1996 law allowing police officers to search an individual's home at any time without a warrant is anti-constitutional
